title: New search for missing MH370 plane will start in December 2025
snippets: New search to start on December 30 for Boeing 777 that went missing in 2014 with 227 passengers and 12 crew members.
Malaysia said deep-sea search operations for the missing Malaysia Airlines MH379 flight will restart on 30 December.
The Malaysian government says it will pay the robotics firm Ocean Infinity $70 million if it can locate the wreckage from the missing flight within a 55-day period.
The Boeing 777 with 239 people on board vanished in 2014 in one of the greatest aviation mysteries.
The deep-sea search will resume this month, with U.S. robotic firm Ocean Infinity carrying out the operation intermittently for 55 days.
Hunt for missing flight MH370 to resume this month, Malaysia says Reuters

The country’s transport ministry said the search would resume on 30 December and confirmed that US robotic company Ocean Infinity would take part The search for the missing Malaysia Airlines flight MH370 will resume this month, the Malaysian transport ministry has said, more than a decade after the

Malaysia's transport ministry said Wednesday that the deep-sea hunt for Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 will resume Dec. 30, renewing hopes of finally locating the jet that vanished without a trace more than a decade ago.

KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia (AP) — More than a decade ago, Malaysia Airlines Flight MH370 vanished without a trace, sparking one of aviation’s most baffling mysteries. Despite years of multinational searches, investigators still do not know exactly what happened to the plane or its 239 passengers and cre

summary: Malaysia's transport ministry announced that a new deep-sea search for Malaysia Airlines Flight MH370, which disappeared in 2014 with 239 people on board, will begin on December 30, 2025. The U.S. robotics firm Ocean Infinity will conduct the search over a 55-day period. The Malaysian government will pay Ocean Infinity $70 million if the wreckage is found. The plane's disappearance remains unsolved.

title: Maple Leafs and Wild win NHL games Stamkos gets 1200 points
snippets: Maple Leafs defeat Panthers, get 3rd win in past 4 games NHL.com
Troy Stecher nets his first of the season to open the scoring, and Dakota Joshua adds another minutes later, leading the Toronto Maple Leafs to a 4–1 win over the Florida Panthers.

Jonas Brodin scored the lone goal of the game and Jesper Wallstedt made 33 saves to record his fourth shutout in his last six appearances, elevating the Minnesota Wild to a 1-0 win over the Edmonton Oilers.
Nathan MacKinnon scored his 21st and 22nd goals of the season while Gabriel Landeskog added two assists to help the Colorado Avalanche beat the Vancouver Canucks 3-1.

Steven Stamkos scored his 1,200th career point and forward Ozzy Wiesblatt scored an emotional first goal of his NHL career as the Nashville Predators ran riot in a dominant 5-1 win over the Calgary Flames.

Moritz Seider had a three-point night with a goal and two assists while Lucas Raymond, Patrick Kane, and Alex DeBrincat each notched two points of their own to elevate the Detroit Red Wings to a 5-4 win over the Boston Bruins.

Artemi Panarin had a pair of assists as the New York Rangers battled back late, with Will Cuylle scoring the tying goal to send it to overtime, where Vladislav Gavrikov tucked home the OT winner of a shot from Panarin.
Tom Wilson opened the scoring the with his 16th goal of the season while Alex Ovechkin added two assists as the Washington Capitals got past the Los Angeles Kings 3-1 on the road.
Anthony Duclair and Bo Horvat each scored while Ilya Sorokin made 28 saves to lead the New York Islanders to a 2-1 win over the Tampa Bay Lightning.
Brady Tkachuk scored his first goal of the season in his return to the Senators’ lineup and had an assist to help lead the Ottawa Senators to a 5-2 win over the Montreal Canadiens.
titles: Maple Leafs defeat Panthers, get 3rd win in past 4 games - NHL.com
NHL Highlights: Maple Leafs 4, Panthers 1
NHL Highlights: Wild 1, Oilers 0
NHL Highlights: Avalanche 3, Canucks 1
NHL Highlights: Predators 5, Flames 1
NHL Highlights: Red Wings 5, Bruins 4
NHL Highlights: Rangers 3, Stars 2 (OT)
NHL Highlights: Capitals 3, Kings 1
NHL Highlights: Islanders 2, Lightning 1
NHL Highlights: Senators 5, Canadiens 2
summary: The Toronto Maple Leafs defeated the Florida Panthers 4–1, marking their third win in four games. The Minnesota Wild shut out the Edmonton Oilers 1–0, with Jonas Brodin scoring and Jesper Wallstedt earning his fourth shutout in six games. Other NHL results include wins for the Avalanche, Predators, Red Wings, Rangers, Capitals, Islanders, and Senators. Notable milestones include Steven Stamkos reaching 1,200 career points.

title: Claude the albino alligator at San Francisco museum dies at 30
snippets: Claude, the de facto mascot for a local museum, was the subject of a children’s book and regularly received fan mail Claude, the beloved albino alligator who called the California Academy of Sciences home for the better part of two decades, has died at age 30. The San Francisco museum announced his
A rare albino alligator named Claude who was beloved by fans around the world died Tuesday, according to the California Academy of Sciences in San Francisco. He was 30.
titles: ‘Iconic swamp king’: San Francisco’s beloved albino alligator dies aged 30
San Francisco's beloved albino alligator Claude dies at 30
summary: Claude, a rare albino alligator and longtime resident of the California Academy of Sciences in San Francisco, died at age 30, the museum announced on Tuesday. Claude was a popular figure, featured in a children’s book and frequently received fan mail from visitors.

summary: Severe storms have caused widespread destruction across South and Southeast Asia. Photos show significant flooding in Indonesia, Sri Lanka, and Thailand, with damaged homes and infrastructure. Emergency response efforts are underway as authorities assess the full extent of the damage.
